There are many ways to prove God's existence. The following example is a good illustration: -The first would be through contemplating this world. By contemplating, one would realize that everything in this world is so well organized, i.e., there is no single thing in the whole universe that is not subject to a certain order or to a certain law. If we take as an example the sun, we find that if the sun goes out of its orbit and gets closer to the earth, everything on the earth would burn out, and if it goes farther, everything would freeze and life on this earth would be impossible. The same order exists at the micro level of a minute cell. Therefore, any person who reflects on the complexity and extreme order of the universe, cannot think that the creation operates under a random and chaotic law. Now, if something materialistic was so well organized, one would intuitively think that there must be someone who organized it this way. Like if one gets into a room and finds it so neat and tidy, he%2Fshe would think straight away that there must be someone who got into that room and tidied it up this way. Then, what about this whole world where we find that everything in it is in its perfect place. Therefore, we conclude that there must be a creator and a master who is all knowing, all wise, all able, and all powerful to do so: and that cannot be but One God. This is only one example and there are millions of examples that can lead any objectively-minded, reasonable person to believe that there is One and Only God.%0D%0A%0D%0A3.
